intro: Galium parisiense proles anglicum, commonly known as English bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, often prostrate stems that produce small, white or pale pink flowers clustered in pairs. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and typically have a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. This plant is known for its historical use in making bedding and as a source of aromatic compounds.
